word_mean: 分心，精神涣散：注意力从体验的主要部位转移或分散在各处
内脱位：一种关节面分离但其韧带尚未破裂，关节也未移位的脱位
骨折分离：由于组织插入或过度牵引使骨折碎片间的空隙增大
手术骨分离：骨横切后，骨的两部分经外科手术分离
牙弓过宽：牙或其他上颌或下颌结构的位置偏离中线。另见contraction

sentence.Network_en: Driven to distraction, he murdered the woman who jilted him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被逼得发狂，于是杀死了抛弃他的那个女人。

sentence.Network_en: A very clingy child can drive a parent to distraction.
sentence.Network_cn: 依赖性太强的孩子会逼得父母心烦意乱。

sentence.Network_en: Let's invite her to the disco — she needs distraction.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们请她去迪斯科舞会 吧,她需要散散心.

lj.lj_ly: he was driven to distraction by the pain in his shoulder.
lj.lj_ls: 肩膀上的痛令他备受困扰。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin distractio(n-), from the verb distrahere (see distract)

entry.tran: 分散注意力的事;使人分心的事
entry.def: A distraction is something that turns your attention away from something you want to concentrate on.

example.ex: I feel this is getting to be a distraction from what I really want to do...
example.tran: 我觉得这开始让我无法集中精神做我真正想做的事情了。

example.ex: Total concentration is required with no distractions.
example.tran: 要全神贯注，不能有丝毫分神。

entry.def: A distraction is an activity which is intended to entertain and amuse you.

example.ex: ...every conceivable distraction from show jumping to bouncy castles...
example.tran: 每一个能想象得到的娱乐项目,从跳跃障碍赛到塑料充气城堡

example.ex: Their national distraction is going to the disco.
example.tran: 他们的全民消遣就是去蹦迪。

entry.tran: 让人心烦意乱;让人恼火
entry.def: If you say that something or someone drives you to distraction, you are emphasizing that they annoy you a great deal.

example.ex: A very clingy child can drive a parent to distraction.
example.tran: 一个非常黏人的孩子会让父母不胜其烦。

means.word_mean: 3. an entertainment that provokes pleased interest and distracts you from worries and vexations
4. the act of distracting; drawing someone's attention away from something;

auth_sentence.content: For others, the home is one giant distraction.

Sentence.sentence: The so-called mindful-eating strategies can fight distractions and help us control our appetite, Brunstrom says
Eating distractions often affect our food digestion
Students already have laptops and cell phones, of course, but the newest devices can take class distractions to a new level.
Distraction is the only thing that consoles us for our miseries.
What does the French philosopher Blaise Pascal say about distraction

means.word_mean: 使人分心的事〔人〕，分散注意力的事 ;娱乐, 消遣

sentences.en: There are too many distractions here to work properly.
sentences.cn: 这里叫人分心的事太多, 使人无法好好工作。

sentences.en: Let’s invite her to the disco—she needs distraction.
sentences.cn: 我们请她去迪斯科舞会吧, 她需要散散心。

means.word_mean: 心烦意乱；(心烦、激动或生气得)发狂

sentences.en: The children are driving me to distraction today.
sentences.cn: 今天孩子们闹得我心烦意乱。

sentences.en: The child’s continual crying drove me to distraction.
sentences.cn: 那孩子不断的哭声弄得我几乎要发疯。
